subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Saturday, 14 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Live - FA Cup
Watford face Man Utd at Villa Park in the first of the weekend's FA Cup semi-finals.



 
Arsenal 2-1 Bolton
Cesc Fabregas strikes the winner as Arsenal steal a march on Bolton in the race for a Champions League spot.



 
Man City 0-0 Liverpool
An insipid game sees Man City and Liverpool share the spoils.








GOLF




Consistent Els leads at halfway
Ernie Els takes the lead at the midway point of the Verizon Heritage tournament in South Carolina.



 
Brier hits the front in Shanghai
Austria's Markus Brier takes the third-round lead at the China Open in Shanghai.



 
Davies maintains form in Florida
Laura Davies and Lorena Ochoa share a three-shot lead after round two of the Ginn Open in Florida.








MOTORSPORT




Massa pips Hamilton to claim pole
Felipe Massa takes pole position for the Bahrain Grand Prix after a head to head battle with English rookie Lewis Hamilton.



 
Bayliss grabs pole start in Spain
World Superbike champion Troy Bayliss will start on pole in Valencia after holding off the local favourite Ruben Xaus.



 
Clockwatch: Bahrain GP qualifying
Felipe Massa edges Lewis Hamilton into second place on the grid for Sunday's Bahrain Grand Prix.








FORMULA ONE




Massa pips Hamilton to claim pole
Felipe Massa takes pole position for the Bahrain Grand Prix after a head to head battle with English rookie Lewis Hamilton.



 
Clockwatch: Bahrain GP qualifying
Felipe Massa edges Lewis Hamilton into second place on the grid for Sunday's Bahrain Grand Prix.



 
Hamilton seeks to make F1 history
Lewis Hamilton could make Formula One history by claiming a third consecutive podium finish in Sunday's Bahrain Grand Prix.








ATHLETICS




Holmes set to race in Manchester
Double Olympic gold medallist Dame Kelly Holmes will take part in the Great Manchester Run.



 
O'Sullivan winds down in Dublin 
Sonia O'Sullivan will make her final Irish road race appearance in Sunday's Great Bupa Ireland Run.



 
Liu signs up to run in British GP
China's Olympic 110m hurdles champion and world record holder Liu Xiang will compete in the British Grand Prix in Sheffield in July.








CYCLING




Cooke's winning run finally ends
Dutch rider Adrie Visser wins the third round of the World Cup, Nicole Cooke edged out in the final sprint.



 
Hammond takes second in Belgium
Britain's Roger Hammond finished in second place in the Gent-Wevelgem one-day classic in Belgium.



 
Cooke powers to Belgium victory
Welsh cyclist Nicole Cooke wins the Tour of Flanders to extend her World Cup lead.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Back to the future with Life on Mars and Manchester United



 
Holloway column
"I won't be having a bet on the Grand National - I've never met a skint bookie"



 
KP's rough guide to Britain
Listen to Pietersen spoof on new Radio 4 show Look Away Now
